intro: Chimarrhis cymosa subsp. genuina, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates. Its narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers make it a striking addition to native gardens. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
